title: Beginner Java Programming Education Course Utilizing Visual Outputs

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and logical reasoning skills
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices to engage in both practical and theoretical learning outside the classroom, intuitively understanding programming concepts through visual outputs

learning_goals: Learners can implement a simple shape-drawing program by applying basic Java syntax using Turtle Graphics.
Learners can generate visual outputs with animation effects using loops and conditional statements.
Learners can write and debug programs that design complex patterns using arrays and nested loop structures.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
